Part 3: Aligned Cylindrical Objects with Varying Heights Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 180.0) and translation vector (0.1275, 0.0825, 0.0). Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.075 units in the opposite direction of the normal. The final model will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a series of cylindrical objects on top, arranged in a straight line. The cylinders are of equal diameter and spaced evenly apart, with varying heights. The prism dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.</description>
